title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 March 2016 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius\_> has quit  
00:47 <evalica> has quit  
01:42 <Enygma`> has quit

08:18 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:25 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:52 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning  
08:53 <vmassol> I'm looking for documentation about setting rights for an AWM-created app but I can't find it on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/App+Within+Minutes+Application However I remember you mentioned it to me that it was something about setting the rights on the "Data" space. Do you think you could document this?  
08:54 <vmassol> (and reply with the link to the user asking the question at thread "Issue after creating application in xwiki") :))  
09:04 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <abusenius\_> has quit  
09:27 <mflorea> vmassol: I'll check later, I'm starting the 8.0RC1 release now. @All, please hold your commits, at least on master  
09:27 <vmassol> ok thanks

11:20 <xwikiorg\_guest\_6> has quit  
11:28 <sdumitriu> has quit  
11:45 <mflorea> tmortagne: I see xwiki-platform-distribution-war depends on xwiki-platform-chart-macro10 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-distribution/xwiki-platform-distribution-war/pom.xml#L975 but I don't find it in platform.  
11:46 <mflorea> this leads to  
11:46 <mflorea> [INFO] Checking dependencies and plugins for snapshots ...  
11:46 <mflorea> There are still some remaining snapshot dependencies.  
11:47 <mflorea> Dependency 'org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-chart-macro10' is a snapshot (8.0-SNAPSHOT)  
11:47 <tmortagne> that's weird, maybe it was moved to contrib around when I merged the new distribution  
11:47 <tmortagne> looksing  
11:47 <mflorea> vmassol: you worked on the char macro recently  
11:47 <mflorea> s/char/chart  
11:48 <tmortagne> hmm actually not sure it's built with legacy profile on ci so it could have been remove a bit before but was not noticed  
11:49 <tmortagne> actually I think I'm the one who moved this macro in 8.0-SNAPSHOT along with 1.0 rendering framework  
11:49 <mflorea> :)  
11:49 <tmortagne> anyway cleaning up and will enable legacy profile  
11:49 <mflorea> I see there is a chart macro in platform  
11:50 <tmortagne> yes but the new one  
11:50 <mflorea> indeed  
11:50 <vmassol> mflorea: yes, I haven't touched at this one in my recent commits  
11:52 <tmortagne> mflorea: should be better now, enabling legacy profile in ci  
11:53 <tmortagne> hmm actually legacy profile is already enabled  
11:53 <tmortagne> so it's just because the SNAPSHOT was still here  
11:53 <tmortagne> removing it from the repo  
11:53 <tmortagne> I shoulds have cleaned the remove when I moved the module to contrib  
11:57 <tmortagne> removed a few old stuff from the snapshot repository  
12:00 <tmortagne> mflorea: by the way you had to enter twice the GPG passphrase at the beginning and then the script never asked you after, right ?  
12:27 <MasterPiece> has joined #xwiki  
12:28 <mflorea> tmortagne: re GPG yes, twice at the start, and never afterwards  
12:28 <mflorea> continuing the release  
12:55 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
12:58 <evalica> has quit  
13:04 <woshilapin> has quit  
13:49 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
13:50 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <vmassol> mflorea: seems Enygma` started it at http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/App+Within+Minutes+Application?viewer=changes&rev2=64.13  
14:08 <vmassol> Enygma`: I think we should mention that the rights on the data space controls the actions available in the action menu  
14:08 <vmassol> (mentioning the rules)  
14:10 <vmassol> I'd create a special section under customizing  for configuring access rights  
14:10 <mflorea> +1  
14:11 <vmassol> @Enygma`: let me guess, you're replying to that user's question right? :)  
14:13 <mflorea> @All, XWiki 8.0RC1 has been released on Git/Maven, you can resume your commits.  
14:14 <vmassol> nice, thanks :)  
14:14 <vmassol> and don't forget that you now need to merge your commits on the stable-8.x branch :)  
14:14 <mflorea> yep  
14:15 <vmassol> (mentioning mostly for myself as I regularly forget ;))  
14:17 <vmassol> mflorea: fyi there's a thread with some feedback about ckeditor which I don't think you've answered yet: " Making Changes to the Editor"  
14:17 <vmassol> (in case you're interested ;))  
14:17 <vmassol> well he had two points and only point 1) is related to CK  
14:18 <mflorea> yes, and it got an answer for 1)  
14:18 <vmassol> it's the same guy who "answered"  
14:19 <mflorea> I now realized it's the same mail address, but the name displayed by gmail before the address is different  
14:19 <vmassol> yeah...  
14:20 <vmassol> anyway just read what he wrote  
14:20 <vmassol> and the only issue seemed to be tthat the page is hidden  
14:20 <vmassol> and he didn't know how to nav to it  
14:20 <vmassol> not sure how we address this globally in our docs though  
14:20 <vmassol> thinking...  
14:20 <vmassol> maybe say:  
14:21 <vmassol> "you can navigate to XXX.YYY" and have a link on "naivgate" to http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+can+I+navigate+to+a+given+page  
14:21 <vmassol> ?  
14:21 <mflorea> yes, I guess I have to improve http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/CKEditor+Integration#HReplacetheDefaultEditor (mentioning that this page is hidden)  
14:21 <vmassol> I think the link might be better  
14:21 <vmassol> it explains more  
14:21 <mflorea> indeed  
14:22 <mflorea> +1 for the link  
14:22 <mflorea> on "navigate"  
14:22 <vmassol> k cool  
14:22 <woshilapin> has quit  
14:23 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:28 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
14:30 <pakhandibaba> has quit  
14:30 <mflorea> vmassol: wdyt http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/CKEditor+Integration#HReplacetheDefaultEditor ?  
14:34 <amook> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <vmassol> mflorea: sounds good  
14:38 <mflorea> ok, I replied to the user  
14:38 <vmassol> yup saw that, thx  
14:39 <vmassol> was fixing http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Features which was listing a lot of extensions that were not bundled with XE  
14:39 <vmassol> (still need to fix the duplicate "skin" entry)

18:49 <asam> has joined #xwiki  
18:53 <vmassol> hmmm  
18:54 <vmassol> ah the release :)  
18:55 <vmassol> hehe  
18:55 <vmassol> was waiting to see if you had read my update at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlanHelp#HForceExtensionsUpdate ;)  
18:56 <vmassol> it's +q and not -q ;)  
18:56 <mflorea> I did made it mute, but I thought the job was done so I unmute, it seems it is still running  
18:56 <vmassol> ok  
18:57 <mflorea> too bad we cannot see the progress of a scheduler job  
18:57 <vmassol> yes...  
19:30 <Trefex> has quit  
19:34 <mflorea> has quit  
19:37 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
19:49 <cjd> has quit  
19:59 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
20:06 <asam> hello  
20:14 <asam>  I am new to XWiki, Please suggest me, How to start contribute in building the UI for Blame View. So, I can Contribute more in the less time?  
20:14 <abhibansal53> has joined #xwiki  
20:20 <abhibansal53> has left #xwiki  
20:32 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
20:49 <ujjwal> has quit  
21:01 <Enygma`> Hi asam  
21:02 <Enygma`> please have a look at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/Guidelines  
21:02 <asam> Hello Enygma  
21:02 <Enygma`> have you read it?  
21:06 <asam> has quit  
21:06 <asam\_> has joined #xwiki  
21:11 <Enygma`> asam\_: if you`ve read the guide (which contains relevant links to resources on getting started and how to contribute), please tell me what specific questions you have  
21:17 <Enygma`> asam\_: as the guidelines say, you need to get up to speed with XWiki basics, find some easy issues on jira.xwiki.org that you can fix and submit some Pull Requests to show us that you can manage it.  
21:17 <asam\_> yes sure.  
21:18 <Enygma`> asam\_: specifically about the Blame View project, you need to look at the blame module to see how it works and how you can use it to get your data that you are going to use in the Blame View  
21:18 <Enygma`> then you need to think of how you can present the data  
21:19 <Enygma`> asam\_: and how you can package your code as an application that you will publish on extensions.xwiki.org for anyone interested to try out  
21:20 <Enygma`> in your proposal, you need to think about what data you will be presenting and also offer some UI mockups  
21:22 <Enygma`> and you`ll need to do an analysis, justify your choices, make a timeline with milestones you plan to follow, stuff like that  
21:27 <asam\_> ok.  
21:27 <evalica1> has quit  
21:27 <asam\_> Thanks for your suggestions.  
21:33 <Enygma`> asam\_: I have updated the project's page on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/BlameView with what we`ve discussed and some extra details  
21:33 <Enygma`> I need to go now, but I will be available for further questions both on IRC and on the mailing list (recommended).  
21:34 <Enygma`> I recommend using the mailing list over the weekend since some devs might not be available.  
21:34 <Enygma`> see you next time  
21:35 <Enygma`> has quit  
21:45 <amook> has quit  
21:49 <asam\_> has quit  
21:50 <vmassol> has quit  
23:23 <MasterPiece> has joined #xwiki  
23:31 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki
